results.title: Cat journey
results.creator_credit: Lisbeth Gabrielsson, Svenska filminstitutet and Educational Media International
results.brief_description: Katie meets a friendly cat which takes her for a rather adventurous ride on its back. Their journey is full of many strange and sometimes scary encounters, but the cat is always there to save Katie. Adapted from the picture book by Ivar Arosenius. Suitable for children 4-7 years.

results.title: Cat's cradle = Au bout du fil
results.creator_credit: Gaston Sarault, ONF | NFB and Paul Driessen
results.brief_description: An animated fable without words starring some Gothic characters - witches, cloaked riders and the like - in a tale about the hungry natural world. Here the artist plays cat’s cradle with ideas, especially the notion that one thing leads to another and lives from another; he supports the action with a witch’s brew of sounds. Awards: Los Angeles; Zagreb

results.title: Cat's cradle
results.creator_credit: Chris McGill, Luigi Acquisto, Liz Hughes, Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Film Victoria
results.brief_description:
The Father lies stiff and near-naked on the kitchen table. His family prepare his body for an outing to the cinema and then carry him through a bleak landscape of concrete roads and decaying factories. This short film combines highly expressionist black and white cinematography with an ominous atmospheric soundtrack. The result is a bizarre and perverse film that has the texture of a dream. Winner of multiple awards for Best Short Film, including prizes at the Melbourne, Edinburgh and London Film Festivals.
Cast includes Helen Rollinson, Ian Nash, Imogen Gough, Paul Bajada, Ryan Giddins and features William McInnes as an extra.

results.title: Casuarina Equisetifolia
results.brief_description: One of a group of four films which look at various species of native trees growing on Stradbroke Island, Queensland. This film is about a species of pine tree called Casuarina Equisetifolia. Groves of these graceful trees grow on the rocky slopes above the ocean where cicadas hum in their branches and the long clusters of Casuarina needles shimmer silver and black in the breeze. The film follows the development of the small cones. The song of the small brown Honey-eater is heard on the sound track mixed in with the sound of a solo flute. Music performed by Nancy Tow.

results.title: Casual encounters of the infectious kind. Pt. 2
results.brief_description: Part two of a-part series. Explains the facilities available for medical examination and, if necessary, treatment of people who think they may have been exposed to sexually transmitted diseases.

results.title: Casual encounters of the infectious kind. Pt. 1
results.brief_description: Part one of a two-part series. Provides basic factual information about infectious diseases which are transmitted by sexual contact. Stresses the importance of seeking proper medical examination and, if necessary, treatment.

results.title: Castro's Cuba
results.creator_credit: Independent Television News (GB), Chris Sheridan and Keith Lambourne
results.brief_description: Cuba has been embargoed by the USA, abandoned by Russia, is one of the remaining issues of the Cold War and is close to bankruptcy, but the citizens of the country still fervently support their leader Fidel Castro. This documentary tells the story of Castro’s rise to power, the revolution of 1959, his reform programmes and his program of relations with the world’s superpowers as well as regional neighbours. It also investigates why this charismatic man is so adored by his citizens and how he has maintained his ‘beloved’ status for so long.

results.title: Castor and Pollux: a tale of two spiritual brothers
results.creator_credit: Tom Manefield, Phil Noyce and AFTRS
results.brief_description: A sometimes humorous, sometimes serious examination of the lifestyles of two middle-aged men in a revolt against conventional living. One is a bikie and the other a hippy.
